SENT.plain: A 20-month-old Hispanic male developed severe aplastic anemia after an episode of non-A, non-B hepatitis
Prompt and complete recovery of all hematopoietic cell lines occurred after treatment with antithymocyte globulin (ATG) and high-dose corticosteroids
Severe aplasia recurred two months later coincident with a mild upper respiratory infection
A second course of immunosuppressive therapy was followed by complete, sustained improvement
The authors' experience provides clinical evidence indicating that immunologic mechanisms are important in the treatment of severe post-hepatitis aplastic anemia
Children in whom aplastic anemia recurs after immunosuppressive treatment may respond to a second course of therapy
